draft_analysis:
**Draft & Win Condition**

- **Enemy comp**: Frontline bruisers (Aatrox, Udyr) + heavy AoE magic damage (Rumble) + hypercarry (Vayne) + enchanter peel/poke (Karma). This is a classic **bruiser frontline + hypercarry + enchanter** team that scales and teamfights extremely well.
- **Your comp**: Urgot + Rammus + Yone + Jhin + Blitz = **pick + short-range DPS** with decent engage but very little peel and limited waveclear from mid. You need to **snowball skirmishes and control vision for picks** before Vayne/Aatrox scale.
- On paper, enemy has the edge: they win **front-to-back fights**, outscale in sidelane (Aatrox vs Urgot/Yone) and in DPS (Vayne vs Jhin), and Karma/Rumble punish your short range when you walk into rivers/chokes.
pick_quality:
**Pick Critique (Yone Mid)**

- Into **Aatrox + Udyr + Rumble + Karma + Vayne**, Yone’s issues: likes long all-ins but enemy has strong **disengage (Karma), anti-melee zones (Rumble R), and tanky frontliners** you can’t burst early. You also add another melee into Udyr/Aatrox, making fights harder.
- From this comp, a **control mage or long-range mid** (e.g. Viktor, Orianna, Syndra) would fit better: frontline damage from safety, better waveclear to protect mid tower (which fell at 14m), and reliable front-to-back scaling.
- If your pool lacks stable control mages, **new champ to learn**: **Viktor** – safe laning, waveclear, DPS vs tanks, synergizes with Rammus/Blitz engage and Jhin follow-up.
story:
**The Turning Point**

- The game flipped between **11–20 minutes**: after a good early kill on Rumble and pick on Vayne, you died **repeatedly in side and river (11m, 13m, 16m, 18m, 20m, 21m)** trying to fight Aatrox/Udyr without setup.
- These deaths coincided with **outer tower losses (mid 14m, top 15m, bot 18m)** and then **mid inner at 22m**, giving enemy total map control; Aatrox went 9/0/5 off these overextensions.
- From there, your comp lost any chance to play picks: enemy grouped, walked down lanes with Baron-like map control, and you had no vision or sidelane threat to contest.
ideal_build:
**Objective Best Build (This Game)**

Enemy threats: heavy healing (Aatrox, Udyr, Vayne), mixed damage with strong frontliners.

- **Core**
  - Berserker's Greaves
  - Blade of the Ruined King (strong vs Aatrox/Udyr/Vayne, dueling + HP shred)
  - Immortal Shieldbow (anti-burst + lifesteal vs AoE Rumble + Vayne crit)
- **Mid game / situational**
  - Wit's End (MR + on-hit DPS vs Rumble + Karma poke, helps vs Udyr if AP stance)
  - Death’s Dance (physical mitigation & heal on takedown vs Aatrox/Udyr focus)
- **Flex 6th** (depending on game state)
  - Guardian Angel (if getting one-shot / need last-fight insurance)
  - Mortal Reminder **upgrade** (only if team lacks enough anti-heal and Aatrox/Udyr/Vayne are unkillable)

**Example final 6**: Berserker's Greaves, Blade of the Ruined King, Immortal Shieldbow, Wit's End, Death's Dance, Guardian Angel.
build_vision:
**Build Critique**

- Your build path: **Doran’s Shield start → Berserker's → Blade of the Ruined King → straight Infinity Edge → very late Executioner’s**.
- Issues:
  - **No Shieldbow**: Against Rumble + Vayne + Aatrox burst, skipping a lifeline made every misstep lethal. You were 0/3 in a row between 16–21m; Shieldbow would have turned some deaths into escapes or kills in skirmishes.
  - **Early Infinity Edge is greedy**: IE is great when ahead and already crit-stacked; in this game you were behind, versus bruisers that stack damage over time. You needed **defensive DPS (Shieldbow/DD/Wit’s End)**, not raw crit.
  - **Late anti-heal**: Aatrox 9/0 and Udyr/Vayne healing heavily, yet Executioner’s only at **27m**. If Rammus isn’t rushing Thornmail + Jhin not rushing early Grievous, you should have **early Executioner’s (after BotRK components)**.
- Ideal adaptation: **Berserker's → BotRK → Shieldbow → Executioner’s (if needed) → Wit's End / DD**. This gives you enough survivability to actually output damage in 5v5s instead of dying on first engage.
mistakes:
**Critical Mistakes & Bad Habits**

1) **What lost THIS game**
- **Repeated deaths during transition to mid game (11–21m)**:
  - Dying to Karma at 9m, then Udyr at 11m, then Vayne at 13m, then Aatrox twice (16m, 18m), then Udyr twice more (20m, 21m) – that’s **7 deaths in 12 minutes**, directly chained to tower losses and Aatrox snowball.
  - These were likely **side-lane or river engages without vision** or without tracking enemy jungle. Yone *must* use E + wave to poke and not snap onto full-HP bruisers without backup.
- **Wrong fights chosen**:
  - Your comp wants **picks with Blitz hook / Rammus taunt + Jhin follow-up**, not long front-to-back into Aatrox/Rumble zones. Your death timestamps line up with fighting on enemy terms rather than setting up picks through vision.

2) **Silent Killer Habits (to fix long-term)**
- **Poor recall + item timing discipline**:
  - Buying items in small pieces and staying on map with awkward spikes (e.g., early Pickaxe/BF towards IE instead of finishing a defensive mythic) led to windows where you were much weaker than Aatrox/Udyr.
- **Over-sidelaning without info**:
  - Deaths at 16m, 18m, 20m, 21m strongly suggest **catching sidelane waves with no river/tribush vision**. As a melee assassin/fighter, you must:
    - Only push sides when you see **at least 3 enemies** on the map.
    - Use E conservatively to test fog and disengage, not as your first gap closer.
- **Lack of anti-heal awareness**:
  - Aatrox + Udyr + Vayne demand **early Grievous** from someone. Track your team’s builds: if they don’t buy it, you must. Delaying this until 27m is a recurring macro mistake that will cost you many games.
- **Not respecting spike timings**:
  - Aatrox with core + level leads will beat you even if you land a good combo. Track enemy mythic/2-item spikes and avoid dueling when you are item down.
verdict:
**Final Verdict**

- The loss came from drafting a short-range melee mid into a strong front-to-back comp, then doubling down with greedy damage itemization and repeated, visionless mid-game deaths that handed Aatrox and Udyr full control of the map.
